body_html: @dchatterjee172 It depends upon how we think the missing parts in sparse gradient. I prefer to regard them as missing gradient (NaN value), rather than zero gradient. Moreover, there is less overhead as compared to update the whole.
body_text: @dchatterjee172 It depends upon how we think the missing parts in sparse gradient. I prefer to regard them as missing gradient (NaN value), rather than zero gradient. Moreover, there is less overhead as compared to update the whole.
body: @dchatterjee172 It depends upon how we think the missing parts in sparse gradient. I prefer to regard them as missing gradient (NaN value), rather than zero gradient. Moreover, there is less overhead as compared to update the whole.
